pubinfo.publish: MNDNR - Division of Ecological and Water Resources - Climatology Group, MN DNR Waters

descript.abstract: MNDNR processing of precipitation data gathered by a variety of entities over 30 year period, from . Data sources include National Weather Service, DNR Forestry, Soil and Water Conservation Districts, and others.
descript.purpose: Climatic analyses and forecasting; hydrologic modeling; and forestry / agricultural analyses

timeperd.current: Data is maintained and up-to-date. Time Period of Content Date indicates when the last major revisions were made. 300 to 1400 precipitation observers gathered data over 30 year period (seasonally varying), 1971-2000.

idinfo.useconst: Use of the data are constrained only by the DNR GIS Data License Agreement. See the Distribution Liability section below for a link.

dataqual.logic: All polygons are closed and lines intersect where intended. Data has been checked for attribute record lengths, dangle errors, label errors, and consistency of arc and polygon attributes and annotation.
dataqual.complete: Coverage exists for entire state of Minnesota; lattices cover 5-state area.

procstep.procdesc:
MNDNR processing of precipitation data gathered by a variety of entities over 30 year period. Data sources include National Weather Service, DNR Forestry, Soil and Water Conservation Districts, and others. 300 to 1400 precipitation observers gathered data over 30 year period (seasonally varying).
Original method of collection was data surfaced with "Surfer" (Golden Software Inc.) application. 10 KM grids of monthly precipitation totals created for month-year using "Surfer". Data translated from "Surfer" format to MGC 100 standard using custom software. Original cell resolution: 0.22239 Acres. Minimum Mapping Unit: 10,000 meters. Date of Collection: 30 years of data, 1971-2000 - coverage prepared November 2002, modified July 2003.

attracc.attraccr: Consistency of arc and polygon attributes has been checked.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).

overview.eaover: GRIDCODE is an incremental index of the number 0.10 inch categories above 18.00 inches. For example, a GRIDCODE of 6 represents a range of normal annual precipitation values from 18.60" (MINVALUE) to 18.70" (MAXVALUE). A GRIDCODE of 163 represents a range of normal annual precipitation values from 34.30" (MINVALUE) to 34.40" (MAXVALUE).
